posts.author: GrinningthroughBlood
posts.content:
Heyo. Looking for a bard/pally build, around arelith's rules.
Musts: no shield, human (lawful bards allowed), hard hitter, PvP viable, PvM survivable.

Thanks!

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: Give us some more details about the specifics of the Bard song in Arelith GtB, is the song the same as original NwN, the duration of the epic song, if the AC bonuses from Divine Shield are affected from the number of the Paladin lvls and so on. Many of the low-magic, restricted lvls PW's have altered the rules in a significant way so we need all the info we can get. We are already aware of the rule of "three straight" lvls before you can switch to another class you have there, if that helps. If you want me to make a rough estimate, i think that a Bard 26/ Paladin 4 is the best you can do if you like to keep the "Undispellable" of your Bard spells. How important is that to you?

posts.author: GrinningthroughBlood
posts.content: No changes at all to base mechanics that I'm aware of. Undispellable is always good. I'd like to be able to pound on PvP wankers, but its not the main goal of the class

posts.author: GrinningthroughBlood
posts.content: Undispellable is nice but not critical.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
If there are no changes to Bard song at all then the epic song is really good and Bard 26/ Paladin 4 will allow you to achieve most/all of what you are looking for. If you want to incorporate other things to your build like enhanced saving throws then Bard 16/ CoT 10/ Paladin 4 is also very good and will allow you for a slight better Ab as well. Personally i would go for Bard 26/ Paladin 4, simple but works wonders and you have both undispellable buffs but also two epic bonus feats. I guess you can achieve 25th lvl Bard song (75 ranks in perform) in your server with skill boosts? If yes, then definitely go for that, 25th lvl Bard song plus 25th lvl Curse song on your enemies in addition to Divine Shield/ Might  and High Taunt, are going to wreck them.

(STR 16 (24)  DEX 08  CON 14  INT 12  WIS 08  CHA 16) - Human

Pre-Epic Feats: WF: Longsword, IC: Longsword, Power Attack, Divine Shield, Divine Might, Blind Fight, Still Spell, Curse Song

Epic Feats: EWF: Longsword, Epic Prowess, Armour Skin, Great STR I, Lasting Inspiration (Bard Bonus), ESF: Perform (Bard Bonus)

Pre-Epic split is (Bard 16/ Paladin 4) in order to achieve 16 BAB and four attacks, then go all ten Bard obviously. You can take any martial weapon that you like, i just choose longsword because it is a universally good option and allows for the shield's AC. If you are able to select stat gifts (if they are available on Arelith now) then go for STR and CHA, the more you have from both, the better. There is also another choice that i did not mention, the (Bard 16/ RDD 10/ Paladin 4) if you go for raw power but i don't know if RDD's are changed on Arelith and anyway the Epic Bard song is really powerful on itself.

posts.author: GrinningthroughBlood
posts.content: Is the bard/pally/cot able to dish out some damage? What would be build specifics for this?

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: A (Bard 16/ Paladin 4/ CoT 10) would have better saves, a slightly better attack bonus and a divine wrath ability usable once per day with some good bonuses that would last for (3 - 9) rounds depending on how much you would be able to enhance your charisma. The downside to this build is that you would lose both the undispellability of your buffs and that your bard song/ curse song would only last for 10 rounds instead of 100 rounds. In addition, many spells that depend on your caster level would be significantly reduced in power. For example " wounding whispers ", a bard spell that causes sonic damage to your enemies each time they hit you with a melee weapon would have only half of it's original power (1d6+16 Vs 1d6 +26). On the plus side, the (bard 16/ cot 10/ paladin 4) combo would be able to pick up a couple of feats more, like " knockdown " and " extend spell ". You want me to make a rough build with CoT as an alternative?

posts.author: GrinningthroughBlood
posts.content: Sure!

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Stats: {STR 16 (26)  DEX 8  CON 14  INT 12  WIS 8  CHA 16} - Human

Pre-Epic (Bard 12/ Paladin 4/ CoT 4) - Epic: (Bard 4/ CoT 6) - "Take your last level as Bard"

Feats: WF: Greatsword, IC: Greatsword, Power Attack, Divine Might, Divine Shield, Blind Fight, Still Spell, Curse Song, Lingering Song, Knockdown

Epic Feats: EWF: Greatsword, Epic Prowess, Armour Skin, Great Strength III, Toughness

Notable Skills: Concentration, Discipline, Spellcraft, Taunt, UMD


BAB: 22 (Four attacks)

Final AB: +34/ +29/ +24/ +19 (Greatsword)

Damage: 2d6 +12/ 17-20 x2 (Greatsword)


Divine Wrath - 1/ Day: +5 AB/ +5 Dmg/ +5 to all saves {Duration is 3-9 rounds Charisma-based}

Divine Shield: +9 AC (with buffed charisma)

Divine Might: +9 Dmg (with buffed charisma)

Bard Song/ Curse Song - 16/ Day: +2 AB/ +3 Dmg/ +3 Will/ +2 Ref/ +2 Fort/ +5 AC/ +4 to all skills / +20 hit points {Duaration is 15 rounds due to lingering song feat}


* As you see, this version has (+2 AB) in comparison to the previous one and a Divine Wrath effect usable one per day. Saves and hit points are improved as well. Take all spell/ song related feats as you level as Bard and aim to take the 3rd and 4th Paladin lvls at 6th and 9th lvls correspondingly. Try to max-out both your Strength and your Charisma, as so many of your abilities rely on the later. A very useful spell to cast in combat is "War Cry", that will give you both +2 AB/ +2 Dmg and may cause fear in your opponents. Wounding whispers are a "must" likewise, as is "Improved invisibility". Really there are too many "buffs variables" in this character and once you use them all she can reach astronomical values in both AB and Dmg.

* If you like to buff before fights, then consider taking "Extend Spell" in place of "Knockdown", having both "Still Spell" and "Extend Spell" in your build adds immense flexibility for a Bard.
